verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician<s%> on <S%H5058>Neginoth<s%>, <S%H4905>Maschil<s%>, A Psalm of <S%H1732>David<s%>. Give <S%H238>ear<s%> to my <S%H8605>prayer<s%>, O <S%H430>God<s%>; and <S%H5956>hide<s%> not thyself from my <S%H8467>supplication<s%>.
<S%H7181>Attend<s%> unto me, and <S%H6030>hear<s%> me: I <S%H7300>mourn<s%> in my <S%H7879>complaint<s%>, and make a <S%H1949>noise<s%>;

Because of the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of the <S%H341>enemy<s%>, <S%H6440>because<s%> of the <S%H6125>oppression<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>: for they <S%H4131>cast<s%> <S%H205>iniquity<s%> upon me, and in <S%H639>wrath<s%> they <S%H7852>hate<s%> me.
My <S%H3820>heart<s%> is sore <S%H2342>pained<s%> <S%H7130>within<s%> me: and the <S%H367>terrors<s%> of <S%H4194>death<s%> are <S%H5307>fallen<s%> upon me.
<S%H3374>Fearfulness<s%> and <S%H7461>trembling<s%> are <S%H935>come<s%> upon me, and <S%H6427>horror<s%> hath <S%H3680>overwhelmed<s%> me. overwhelmed: Heb. covered
And I <S%H559>said<s%>, Oh <S%H5414>that<s%> I had <S%H83>wings<s%> like a <S%H3123>dove<s%>! for then would I fly <S%H5774>away<s%>, and be at <S%H7931>rest<s%>.
Lo, then would I <S%H5074>wander<s%> far <S%H7368>off<s%>, and <S%H3885>remain<s%> in the <S%H4057>wilderness<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>.
I would <S%H2363>hasten<s%> my <S%H4655>escape<s%> from the <S%H7307>windy<s%> <S%H5584>storm<s%> and <S%H5591>tempest<s%>.
<S%H1104>Destroy<s%>, O <S%H136>Lord<s%>, and <S%H6385>divide<s%> their <S%H3956>tongues<s%>: for I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H2555>violence<s%> and <S%H7379>strife<s%> in the <S%H5892>city<s%>.
<S%H3119>Day<s%> and <S%H3915>night<s%> they go <S%H5437>about<s%> it upon the <S%H2346>walls<s%> thereof: <S%H205>mischief<s%> also and <S%H5999>sorrow<s%> are in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of it.
<S%H1942>Wickedness<s%> is in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> thereof: <S%H8496>deceit<s%> and <S%H4820>guile<s%> <S%H4185>depart<s%> not from her <S%H7339>streets<s%>.

For it was not an <S%H341>enemy<s%> that <S%H2778>reproached<s%> me; then I could have <S%H5375>borne<s%> it: neither was it he that <S%H8130>hated<s%> me that did <S%H1431>magnify<s%> himself against me; then I would have <S%H5641>hid<s%> myself from him:
But it was thou, a <S%H582>man<s%> mine <S%H6187>equal<s%>, my <S%H441>guide<s%>, and mine <S%H3045>acquaintance<s%>. mine equal: Heb. according to my rank
We took <S%H4985>sweet<s%> <S%H5475>counsel<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%>, and <S%H1980>walked<s%> unto the <S%H1004>house<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%> in <S%H7285>company<s%>. We: Heb. Who sweetened counsel

Let <S%H4194>death<s%> <S%H5377>seize<s%> <S%H3451><s%> upon them, and let them go <S%H3381>down<s%> <S%H2416>quick<s%> into <S%H7585>hell<s%>: for <S%H7451>wickedness<s%> is in their <S%H4033>dwellings<s%>, and <S%H7130>among<s%> them. hell: or, the grave
As for me, I will <S%H7121>call<s%> upon <S%H430>God<s%>; and the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall <S%H3467>save<s%> me.
<S%H6153>Evening<s%>, and <S%H1242>morning<s%>, and at <S%H6672>noon<s%>, will I <S%H7878>pray<s%>, and cry <S%H1993>aloud<s%>: and he shall <S%H8085>hear<s%> my <S%H6963>voice<s%>.
He hath <S%H6299>delivered<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> in <S%H7965>peace<s%> from the <S%H7128>battle<s%> that was against me: for there were <S%H7227>many<s%> with me.

<S%H410>God<s%> shall <S%H8085>hear<s%>, and <S%H6030>afflict<s%> them, even he that <S%H3427>abideth<s%> of <S%H6924>old<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>. Because they have no <S%H2487>changes<s%>, therefore they <S%H3372>fear<s%> not <S%H430>God<s%>. Because: or, With whom also there be no changes, yet they
He hath put <S%H7971>forth<s%> his <S%H3027>hands<s%> against such as be at <S%H7965>peace<s%> with him: he hath <S%H2490>broken<s%> his <S%H1285>covenant<s%>. broken: Heb. profaned

The words of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> were <S%H2505>smoother<s%> than <S%H4260>butter<s%>, but <S%H7128>war<s%> was in his <S%H3820>heart<s%>: his <S%H1697>words<s%> were <S%H7401>softer<s%> than <S%H8081>oil<s%>, yet were they drawn <S%H6609>swords<s%>.

<S%H7993>Cast<s%> thy <S%H3053>burden<s%> upon the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and he shall <S%H3557>sustain<s%> thee: he shall <S%H5769>never<s%> <S%H5414>suffer<s%> the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> to be <S%H4131>moved<s%>. burden: or, gift

But thou, O <S%H430>God<s%>, shalt bring them <S%H3381>down<s%> into the <S%H875>pit<s%> of <S%H7845>destruction<s%>: <S%H1818>bloody<s%> and <S%H4820>deceitful<s%> <S%H582>men<s%> shall not live out <S%H2673>half<s%> their <S%H3117>days<s%>; but I will <S%H982>trust<s%> in thee. bloody: Heb. men of bloods and deceit shall: Heb. shall not half their days
